cofh.api.inventory

Interface IInventoryHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IInventoryConnection

    public interface IInventoryHandler
extends IInventoryConnection
    Implement this interface on TileEntities which should handle items. A reference implementation is provided TileInventoryHandler.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface cofh.api.inventory.IInventoryConnection

        IInventoryConnection.ConnectionType

      • Methods inherited from interface cofh.api.inventory.IInventoryConnection

        canConnectInventory

    • Method Detail

      • insertItem

        ItemStack insertItem(ForgeDirection from,
                   ItemStack item,
                   boolean simulate)
        Insert an ItemStack into the IInventoryHandler, internal distribution is left entirely to the IInventoryHandler. This returns what is remaining of the original stack - a null return means that the entire stack was accepted!
        Parameters:
        from - Orientation the item is inserted from.
        item - ItemStack to be inserted. The size of this stack corresponds to the maximum amount to insert.
        simulate - If TRUE, the insertion will only be simulated.
        Returns:
        An ItemStack representing how much is remaining after the item was inserted (or would have been, if simulated) into the container inventory.

      • extractItem

        ItemStack extractItem(ForgeDirection from,
                    ItemStack item,
                    boolean simulate)
        Extract an ItemStack from an IInventoryHandler, internal distribution is left entirely to the IInventoryHandler. This returns the resulting stack - a null return means that nothing was extracted!
        Parameters:
        from - Orientation the item is extracted from.
        item - ItemStack to be extracted. The size of this stack corresponds to the maximum amount to extract. If this is null, then a null ItemStack should immediately be returned.
        simulate - If TRUE, the extraction will only be simulated.
        Returns:
        An ItemStack representing how much was extracted (or would have been, if simulated) from the container inventory.

      • extractItem

        ItemStack extractItem(ForgeDirection from,
                    int maxExtract,
                    boolean simulate)
        Extract an ItemStack from an IInventoryHandler, internal distribution is left entirely to the IInventoryHandler. This returns the resulting stack - a null return means that nothing was extracted!
        Parameters:
        from - Orientation the item is extracted from.
        maxExtract - Maximum number of items to extract. (The returned ItemStack should have a stackSize no higher than this.)
        simulate - If TRUE, the extraction will only be simulated.
        Returns:
        An ItemStack representing how much was extracted (or would have been, if simulated) from the container inventory.

      • getInventoryContents

        java.util.List<ItemStack> getInventoryContents(ForgeDirection from)
        Get the contents of the IInventoryHandler's inventory. This returns a COPY. This should only return non-null ItemStacks, and an empty List if the inventory has nothing.

      • getSizeInventory

        int getSizeInventory(ForgeDirection from)
        Get the size (number of internal slots) of the IInventoryHandler's inventory.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty(ForgeDirection from)
        Returns whether or not the IInventoryHandler's inventory is empty (for a given side).

      • isFull

        boolean isFull(ForgeDirection from)
        Returns whether or not the IInventoryHandler's inventory is full (for a given side).
